children.name: Text
children.value: Brings out the best bonding moments.

children.name: Text
children.value: Nothing brings two people together as sharing a smoke.

children.name: Text
children.value: What, think I was born yesterday?

children.name: Text
children.value: I very rarely trade at that price.

children.name: Text
children.value: I'd lose big on that one.

children.name: Text
children.value: Lower than I would normally go.

children.name: Text
children.value: Maybe...I won't say better than that...

children.name: Text
children.value: I'm thinking about it at least...

children.name: Text
children.value: That wouldn't be such a bad deal...

children.name: Text
children.value: I'm going to tell everyone you tried to bribe me!

children.name: Text
children.value: I have almost no idea what you're suggesting.

children.name: Text
children.value: If you mean what I think you do, you'll be lucky!

children.name: Text
children.value: I think it'll take more than that to turn me.

children.name: Text
children.value: Come now...it's me that'll get it in the neck...

children.name: Text
children.value: You're asking a lot of me...

children.name: Text
children.value: Me, take a bribe?! Though it isn't a bad offer...

children.name: Text
children.value: That's a good offer. If I take it, you better not tell a soul.

children.name: Text
children.value: Very tempting, and every soul has their price!

children.name: Text
children.value: It's a deal! Loyalty means nothing to me!

children.name: Text
children.value: Are you going to offer something?

children.name: Text
children.value: I have no idea what it is that you're offering.

children.name: Text
children.value: I very much doubt I could find a use for that.

children.name: Text
children.value: Kind thought, but a bit of a long shot...

children.name: Text
children.value: I'm not sure how helpful that would be...

children.name: Text
children.value: Maybe I could make use of that...maybe...

children.name: Text
children.value: I can imagine how that might be of benefit...

children.name: Text
children.value: I'm almost certain that would be a great help.

children.name: Text
children.value: I'd be absolutely over the moon!

children.name: Text
children.value: Ok, we can agree to these terms!

children.name: Text
children.value: This mistake is the last straw. Your crew don't have a grain of trust in their superiors, and decide to take their chances alone. It's all-out mutiny. Your expedition is lost.

children.name: Text
children.value: This article still needs a headline and text.

children.name: Text
children.value: Farmers flock to join [Participants Current Profile CompanyName], hoping to prosper from the earth as they always have done. At least at first, there will be little time for kips behind the haystack, as new settlement begins to find its feet...

children.name: Text
children.value: First workers bustle into [Participants Current Profile CompanyName], trading sleepy plough for bright industrial future. Bold new era begins, as the furnaces are lit, plumes of smoke issue from chimney stacks, and workers don the grim and gritty garb of the factories.

children.name: Text
children.value: New Artisan arrivals add culture and sophistication to [Participants Current Profile CompanyName], exhibiting flair and flourish formerly lacking. Gauzy fabrics and perfume enswathe this troupe of motley individualists. See special pullout within, entitled "Herding Cats."

children.name: Text
children.value: First Engineers bring discovery to city! Books, telescopes and chemicals under arm, they arrive in uniform rows, peering over spectacles at their new habitat. Their welcome rationality is sure to trigger sharp upturn in efficiency and advancement.

children.name: Text
children.value: First Investors arrive! Umbrellas tap pavement, and capacious top hats devour hatstands, the elite are finally here! Markets expected to see major growth in coming weeks, with share prices already soaring. For list of potential investments see finance pp. 14-17.

children.name: Text
children.value: [Participants Current Profile CompanyName] settles first island! Hopes abound seed will germinate into great leafy tree— boughs heavy with golden fruit! In historic edition, we profile company pioneer, and enjoy the positivity— who knows if we shall see its like again!

children.name: Text
children.value: [Participants Current Profile CompanyName] settles first island in the new world. Sticky financial climate at first, but refreshing cloudbursts forecast! Previously unhinhabited island to act as initial HQ for overseas business in waters hitherto uncharted!

children.name: Text
children.value: [Participants Current Profile CompanyName] incorporates new territory in bold move! Hopes for splendid new settlement arise! Uninhabited island meets with humankind for the first time, as company brings this secluded idyll into the fold.

children.name: Name
children.value: HL - New Island Settled Other Participant - Neutral

children.name: Name
children.value: SL - New Island Settled Other Participant - Neutral

children.name: Text
children.value: One of our competitors has settled a new island in the region, according to reports. If this will spur our own enterprise is hard to determine, but at the least it serves as a reminder of the challenge for resources our people face.

children.name: Text
children.value: Previously uncharted island found! The uninhabited spot is full of promise, say surveyors, who were among the first to wade up the beach this morning alongside excited cartographers, botanists and investors keen to sniff the place out.

children.name: Text
children.value: New competitors appear from beyond our borders have us brimming with anticipation. Will they be naughty, will they be nice? Will they bring us fish-tails, bird eggs or mice? Our foreign correspondent digs up more juicy morsels concerning our new neighbours pp.17-18.

children.name: Text
children.value: [Participants Current Profile CompanyName] has discovered a new region overseas, and is already going about the business of gathering the necessary to establish an outpost there. For those wishing to see the world, there has never been such a time as now, apply at once within!

children.name: Name
children.value: HL - New Moderate Session Unlocked - Positive

children.name: Name
children.value: SL - New Moderate Session Unlocked - Positive

children.name: Text
children.value: [Participants Current Profile CompanyName] discovers new region, and is rumoured already to be considering investing time and resources there. Keen to seek your fortune in distant places? Speculative applications welcome!

children.name: Name
children.value: HL - New Colony Session Unlocked - Positive

children.name: Name
children.value: SL - New Colony Session Unlocked - Positive

children.name: Text
children.value: [Participants Current Profile CompanyName] has discovered a new clutch of islands overseas, and is rumoured already to be considering investing time and resources there. Keen to seek your fortune in faraway places? Speculative applications welcome!

children.name: Text
children.value: [Participants Current Profile CompanyName] soaring high, as recently published estimations rank our people more advanced than ever before. "I have faith our governor will sustain this exponential growth", declares monocle-wielder, "we leap like young salmon!"

children.name: Name
children.value: HL - Player Level Reached Other Participant - Neutral

children.name: Name
children.value: SL - Player Level Reached Other Participant - Neutral

children.name: Text
children.value: With recent key advance for our rival, we cast our eyes over the strengths and weaknesses of their company, asking whether they might pose a threat to us. Full and frank analysis pages 3-5.

children.name: Name
children.value: HL - Player Level Reached Other Participant Higher- Negative

children.name: Name
children.value: SL - Player Level Reached Other Participant Higher- Negative

children.name: Text
children.value: Our rival is striding away! While we like a spotty bottom are eclipsed! Let us dwell on our inferiority, carefully inspect our failings, and wonder how we might possibly catch them back up before the great race is over!

children.name: Text
children.value: Worthy trade boat leaves [Newspaper FindArticle([RefGuid]) Context TownName] ready for maiden voyage! Capacious hold asking to be filled to brim with riches, which naturally, will be shared among loyal populace!

children.name: Text
children.value: Proud new warship [Newspaper FindArticle([RefGuid]) Context TownName] on first patrol! Brave crew wished luck by loved ones, and revelling in the romance of not knowing if they'll ever come back!

children.name: Text
children.value: [Participants Current Profile CompanyName] spawns armada! To what purpose we can only hazard a guess, but whether for naval victory or merchant profit, a larger fleet must always be better!

children.name: Text
children.value: A lack of manpower is holding back our shipbuilding! There are plenty of jobs to be done down at the dock, but no-one seems suitable or interested enough to take up these positions.

children.name: Name
children.value: HL - Several Trading Ships Constructed - Good

children.name: Name
children.value: SL - Several Trading Ships Constructed - Good

children.name: Text
children.value: [Newspaper FindArticle([RefGuid]) Context TownName] spawns merchant navy! Trade must flourish, now this bright and colourful selection are dispatched with their ample tonnages, perhaps to meet with new and exotic trade partners!

children.name: Name
children.value: HL - Several Military Ships Constructed - Good

children.name: Name
children.value: SL - Several Military Ships Constructed - Good

children.name: Text
children.value: [Newspaper FindArticle([RefGuid]) Context TownName] spawns awe-inspiring naval armada! Of what noble victories and conquests may we now dream?! Let us rejoice, and blissfully ignore any possiblity they may be used to serve unjust causes!

children.name: Name
children.value: HL - First Steam Ship Constructed - Good

children.name: Name
children.value: SL - First Steam Ship Constructed - Good

children.name: Text
children.value: First ever steam vessel christened for [Participants Current Profile CompanyName]! Never more shall bad winds addle our business, or put our navy off their stride! No! Steam, stoked and screw-propellered shall surge us ever more into contention!

children.name: Text
children.value: Settlers arrive in numbers to [Newspaper FindArticle([RefGuid]) Context TownName], its illustrious doors opening to reveal shimmering utopia! Of course, had they lived here, they would know it was not entirely like that, but still, growth is good!

children.name: Text
children.value: For masses desperately fleeing dastardly [Newspaper FindArticle([RefGuid]) Context TownName], life couldn't possibly have been worse! That people would pack their worldly possessions and run, only goes to show what dire straits the town finds itself in.

children.name: Text
children.value: 'We are as joyful as we can possibly be!' the hysterical people squeal, as they dance the euphoric streets of [Newspaper FindArticle([RefGuid]) Context TownName]! If there is indeed a secret recipe for happiness, our fair city must contain all of the desired ingredients!

children.name: Text
children.value: [Newspaper FindArticle([RefGuid]) Context TownName] is quite full of mirth! "Eight and three-fifths from ten is how I score my present feeling," one resident remarked during recent census, "yet I am not completely delirious..."

children.name: Text
children.value: [Newspaper FindArticle([RefGuid]) Context TownName] is a dull, occasionally satisfactory place to live, according to residents. Why is this town so run-of-the-mill, when it could be so very much more? We detail in full pp. 3-7 exactly what makes life here so bland...

children.name: Text
children.value: Local hearts filled with woe in [Newspaper FindArticle([RefGuid]) Context TownName]! Streets wet with tears, as residents weep for the neglect! "I still want to believe in this place," says one we met, "But the dream is dying!"

children.name: Text
children.value: Anger at living conditions in [Newspaper FindArticle([RefGuid]) Context TownName]! Residents on verge of drastic action to end hardship! Our newspaper maintains responsibility to report the grievous situation of the people, though our livelihoods may suffer for it!

children.name: Text
children.value: Happier days return to [Newspaper FindArticle([RefGuid]) Context TownName]! Either people have learned better to cope, or indeed as this paper believes, living conditions have demonstrably improved in recent times. More grounds for domestic optimism pp. 5 & 6.

children.name: Text
children.value: Mood slumps in [Newspaper FindArticle([RefGuid]) Context TownName] as reality of living conditions hit home. Something must be done to recover this city to former glory! With the assistance of local residents, we have compiled a long list of the most urgent improvements...

children.name: Text
children.value: The lack of fresh produce available in [Newspaper FindArticle([RefGuid]) Context TownName] is thoroughly depressing! When will the city council see sense and provide the people the variety and bounty of a proper market?

children.name: Text
children.value: Scarcity of fish in [Newspaper FindArticle([RefGuid]) Context TownName] due to shameful mismanagement, leaves town in a flap. Many will have a bone to pick with the governor, unless net quantities soon improve.

children.name: Text
children.value: Scarcity of Schnapps in [Newspaper FindArticle([RefGuid]) Context TownName] due to shameful mismanagement, means very essence of society may soon evaporate! Locals not sure where to turn after bottle taken away!

children.name: Text
children.value: Scarcity of Basic Clothes in [Newspaper FindArticle([RefGuid]) Context TownName] due to shameful mismanagement, means very fabric of society may soon disintegrate! Many left with nothing to wear in the week, let alone Sunday best!

children.name: Text
children.value: Lack of pub in [Newspaper FindArticle([RefGuid]) Context TownName] is a jolly poor show. If there's one thing that could bring this disparate community together, it is ale, a roaring fire, and a trio of fiddlers!

children.name: Text
children.value: Scarcity of sausage in [Newspaper FindArticle([RefGuid]) Context TownName] due to shameful mismanagement leaves locals feeling raw. Worries salivating carnivores may start eyeing each other for the butcher's slab!

children.name: Text
children.value: Scarcity of bread in [Newspaper FindArticle([RefGuid]) Context TownName] due to half-baked management means society may collapse in on itself. We're yet to see a single crumb of evidence in respect of a solution...

children.name: Text
children.value: With no church in [Newspaper FindArticle([RefGuid]) Context TownName], gossip grows elsewhere that town is cauldron of devil worship. Of course nothing could be further from the truth!— But while there is no church, we shall continue to be branded with the hoof.

children.name: Text
children.value: Scarcity of soap in [Newspaper FindArticle([RefGuid]) Context TownName] due to shameful mismanagement leaves locals smelling appalling! The merest smidge of lavender and camphor would be enough for us to unclasp the clothes pegs from our probosces!

children.name: Text
children.value: Scarcity of beer in [Newspaper FindArticle([RefGuid]) Context TownName] due to shameful mismanagement means soul of society is draining away!

children.name: Text
children.value: Lack of a school in [Newspaper FindArticle([RefGuid]) Context TownName] means locals are really thick. We can but hope some sentience may emerge from this pool of ignorance, and put things to right by building one.

children.name: Text
children.value: Scarcity of canned food in [Newspaper FindArticle([RefGuid]) Context TownName] due to tin-pot mismanagement leaves society feeling crushed.

children.name: Text
children.value: Scarcity of sewing machines in [Newspaper FindArticle([RefGuid]) Context TownName] has town in a tangle! Settlement hoping the loose ends will be tied up soon.

children.name: Text
children.value: Still no Variety Theatre in [Newspaper FindArticle([RefGuid]) Context TownName]! Local poets spew bitter verse attacking the powers-that-be who would deny them even the smallest of freedoms.

children.name: Text
children.value: Shortage of rum in [Newspaper FindArticle([RefGuid]) Context TownName] very rum indeed! Rocky patch for rum sees locals fall from hammocks, and grey clouds fill in the sky. We petition governor to bring the sunshine back!

children.name: Text
children.value: Fur coats go missing in [Newspaper FindArticle([RefGuid]) Context TownName]! Animal retaliation theory disproven, as Town council shoulders all responsibility.

children.name: Text
children.value: Absence of University in [Newspaper FindArticle([RefGuid]) Context TownName] makes town "provincial backwater", say scholars hoping to be institutionalised. "Without it, none of us will ever amount to anything!"

children.name: Text
children.value: No sign of Spectacles in [Newspaper FindArticle([RefGuid]) Context TownName]! Locals want transparency with regard to the recent shortages, mystified by town's lack of vision.

children.name: Text
children.value: Penny Farthings disappear in [Newspaper FindArticle([RefGuid]) Context TownName], as last few models cycle out of stock. We ask why no-one is stepping up to steer things back in the right direction.

children.name: Text
children.value: What sane working person can be expected to work without coffee? Is the question we put to [Newspaper FindArticle([RefGuid]) Context TownName] local council, in the hope they will grind out a solution.

children.name: Text
children.value: Shortage of Pocket Watches in [Newspaper FindArticle([RefGuid]) Context TownName] damaging efficiency! With time ticking on, officials are under pressure to solve the matter post-haste!

children.name: Text
children.value: Lack of Electricity supply throttling [Newspaper FindArticle([RefGuid]) Context TownName] production! Authorities charged with ensuring supply resumes quick as a flash.

children.name: Text
children.value: Lifespan of Light Bulbs questioned in [Newspaper FindArticle([RefGuid]) Context TownName], as supplies run low. People hoping local council will have some bright ideas for a change.

children.name: Text
children.value: Continuing lack of Bank in [Newspaper FindArticle([RefGuid]) Context TownName] has moneymen drawing on new reserves of patience, as cash spills out of bedsprings everywhere.

children.name: Text
children.value: Champagne shortage in [Newspaper FindArticle([RefGuid]) Context TownName] takes the fizz out of life. Trust in authorities put on ice, as supply continues to falter.

children.name: Text
children.value: Shortage of Cigars in [Newspaper FindArticle([RefGuid]) Context TownName] is nothing but a headache for wealthy investors hoping to get their circulation back.

children.name: Text
children.value: Lack of a decent Members Club in [Newspaper FindArticle([RefGuid]) Context TownName] disappoints work hard, play hard crowd, who want somewhere to crash when the financial markets do. Ties and cufflinks expected in the post pronto, or there'll be trouble!

children.name: Text
children.value: Chocolate shortage in [Newspaper FindArticle([RefGuid]) Context TownName] sends place into meltdown. Grandfathers disappoint grandchildren by hoarding it all to themselves, and licorice substitutes failing to meet with same degree of enthusiasm.

children.name: Text
children.value: Absence of Jewellery in [Newspaper FindArticle([RefGuid]) Context TownName] is destroying the status of the town, wealthy residents are complaining. "For lack of alternatives, I have been forced to wear family heirlooms on stage," sighed local diva.

children.name: Text
children.value: Gramophone shortage in [Newspaper FindArticle([RefGuid]) Context TownName] as machines prove too popular. "Music shouldn't be this popular," rants frustrated snob, "Only those who truly know how to listen should be allowed them!"

children.name: Text
children.value: Shortage of Steam Carriages in [Newspaper FindArticle([RefGuid]) Context TownName] is driving everybody quite mad! Authorities need to get a grip on the wheel soon, or stymied local motorists may combust!

children.name: Text
children.value: Fried Plantains run out in [Newspaper FindArticle([RefGuid]) Context TownName]. Cross local remarks "If I don't get my plantains fried in fish oil, I don't know what I'll do!"

children.name: Text
children.value: Scarcity of Ponchos in [Newspaper FindArticle([RefGuid]) Context TownName] leaves hill-dwelling locals envious of smug Alpaca. Outrage over missing supply means there is little in the way of warm fuzzy feelings.

children.name: Text
children.value: Tortillas extremely thin on the ground in [Newspaper FindArticle([RefGuid]) Context TownName], leaving city feeling flat. "They better scoop us out of this soon, or the whole thing will leave a very bad taste in the mouth."

children.name: Text
children.value: Still no Boxing Ring in [Newspaper FindArticle([RefGuid]) Context TownName]! Worries locals may start unregulated fight club of their own if no official venue is organised soon.

children.name: Text
children.value: Scarcity of Bombins in [Newspaper FindArticle([RefGuid]) Context TownName] highly unprofessional! "Without comfortable headwear we are lost!" says sartorial snob, his shining bald patch exposed to the elements.

children.name: Text
children.value: [Participants Current Profile CompanyName] is in the red, and it can only be 'a matter of time before the bailiffs come' to reclaim furniture and wallpaper! This will mean the end if this disastrous venture is not turned around soon!

children.name: Text
children.value: As positive credit balance hastens era of untold prosperity, [Participants Current Profile CompanyName] said to have Midas touch! Yes, that didn't end too well for poor old Midas, but let's not dwell on the negatives!

children.name: Text
children.value: Income is no longer in the negative for [Participants Current Profile CompanyName] according to financial analysis. "We're headed back in the right direction at least!" concedes backer, forced to come down off high horse.

children.name: Name
children.value: HL - Bank Account Negative Past - neutral

children.name: Name
children.value: SL - Bank Account Negative Past - neutral

children.name: Text
children.value: [Participants Current Profile CompanyName] bounces back from bankruptcy! Accounts no longer overdrawn! "A miraculous turnaround!" prate fickle and useless advisors that likely precipitated the crisis in the first place.

children.name: Name
children.value: HL - Bank Account Negative Present - bad

children.name: Name
children.value: SL - Bank Account Negative Present - bad

children.name: Text
children.value: [Participants Current Profile CompanyName] plagued by prospect of bankruptcy! Accounts overdrawn! "A miraculous turnaround" required, according to fickle and useless advisors that likely precipitated the crisis in the first place.

children.name: Name
children.value: HL - Bank Account Positive Present - Good

children.name: Name
children.value: SL - Bank Account Positive Present - Good

children.name: Text
children.value: We are really raking in the money, according to our smell-fingered coin counters! Or rather our proud company management is. Always a chance they may spend it on you though, if you smile and congratulate them, trust me I know.

children.name: Text
children.value: Brutally driven from dawn 'til dusk, the tyrannised population of [Newspaper FindArticle([RefGuid]) Context TownName] suffer like the yoked beasts of Lucifer. City cries out for someone to rise up and put an end to its medieval overlords!

children.name: Text
children.value: Dreadful working conditions persist for Farmers of [Participants Current Profile CompanyName], who have remained chained to the grindstone for this underhand and unprincipled state it seems, forever and a day. We can only hope change will come, and soon! Sign the petition!

children.name: Text
children.value: Dreadful working conditions persist for Workers of [Participants Current Profile CompanyName], who have held their faces to the furnace for this underhand and unprincipled state it seems, forever and a day. We can only hope change will come, and soon! Sign the petition!

children.name: Text
children.value: Dreadful working conditions persist for Artisans of [Participants Current Profile CompanyName], who have remained chained to their trestles for this underhand and unprincipled state it seems, forever and a day. We can only hope change will come, and soon! Sign the petition!

children.name: Text
children.value: Dreadful working conditions persist for Engineers of [Participants Current Profile CompanyName], who have remained fused to their flasks for this underhand and unprincipled state it seems, forever and a day. We can only hope change will come, and soon! Sign the petition!

children.name: Text
children.value: Dreadful working conditions persist for Jornaleros of [Participants Current Profile CompanyName], who have run themselves into the ground for this underhand and unprincipled state it seems, forever and a day. We can only hope change will come, and soon! Sign the petition!

children.name: Text
children.value: Dreadful working conditions persist for Obreros of [Participants Current Profile CompanyName], who have had to work their hands to dust for this underhand and unprincipled state it seems, forever and a day. We can only hope change will come, and soon! Sign the petition!

children.name: Text
children.value: With many on generous working terms in [Newspaper FindArticle([RefGuid]) Context TownName], liberals and employess alike heap praise upon altruistic visionaries in charge of this most progressive city.

children.name: Name
children.value: HL - Workforce Farmer Workforce Low - Bad

children.name: Name
children.value: SL - Workforce Farmer Workforce Low - Bad

children.name: Text
children.value: Lack of farmers in [Newspaper FindArticle([RefGuid]) Context TownName] mean problems for local produce. "We need all the help we can get if the harvest is not to be a disaster," says one disgruntled local, left in the lurch.

children.name: Name
children.value: HL - Workforce Worker Workforce Low - Bad

children.name: Name
children.value: SL - Workforce Worker Workforce Low - Bad

children.name: Text
children.value: Lack of able workers causing problems for industry in [Newspaper FindArticle([RefGuid]) Context TownName]. "I told the guv, I don't have the experience to work in this section alone," said one chagrined employee, wishing to remain anonymous.

children.name: Name
children.value: HL - Workforce Artisan Workforce Low - Bad

children.name: Name
children.value: SL - Workforce Artisan Workforce Low - Bad

children.name: Text
children.value: Too few Artisans in [Newspaper FindArticle([RefGuid]) Context TownName] means local craft will suffer. "When I said I enjoyed the isolation, I didn't imagine being forever alone..." weeps beleaguered local dandy, hand upon brow.

children.name: Name
children.value: HL - Workforce Engineer Workforce Low - Bad

children.name: Name
children.value: SL - Workforce Engineer Workforce Low - Bad

children.name: Text
children.value: Not enough Engineers in [Newspaper FindArticle([RefGuid]) Context TownName] to keep city in good working order, says survey. "It's terrible, the lack of investment in further research," pencil-chewing curiosity remarks. More bad science, pp. 19-20.

children.name: Name
children.value: HL - Workforce Investor Workforce Low - Bad

children.name: Name
children.value: SL - Workforce Investor Workforce Low - Bad

children.name: Text
children.value: A lack of investment in [Newspaper FindArticle([RefGuid]) Context TownName] is extremely damaging for the local economy, financial report shows. "It's a damned farce," was the only comment we could extract from those who had already given their backing in the region.

children.name: Name
children.value: HL - Workforce Jornalero Workforce Low - Bad

children.name: Name
children.value: SL - Workforce Jornalero Workforce Low - Bad

children.name: Text
children.value: Jornaleros workforce dwindles in [Newspaper FindArticle([RefGuid]) Context TownName], with even the old guard admitting they need some fresh blood. "Alpaca will not do all this work, she'll give up, run back to the foothills," fears overburdened local.

children.name: Name
children.value: HL - Workforce Obrero Workforce Low - Bad

children.name: Name
children.value: SL - Workforce Obrero Workforce Low - Bad

children.name: Text
children.value: Obreros are too few in number to keep their visioon of the future alive in [Newspaper FindArticle([RefGuid]) Context TownName]. "This place, is too much in the past. When will we grow and move on?" says earnest and principled resident.

children.name: Text
children.value: As first visitors arrive in [Newspaper FindArticle([RefGuid]) Context TownName], there is belief that town can quickly become a popular destination for tours and excursions, and that its many features and amenities can have a lasting appeal.

children.name: Text
children.value: Visitor numbers surge in [Newspaper FindArticle([RefGuid]) Context TownName], as delirious sightseers rush to unprise the holiday purse, and pour much-needed revenue into our beloved city. Local businesses must be thriving!

children.name: Text
children.value: Visitors desert [Newspaper FindArticle([RefGuid]) Context TownName] in favour of more attractive destinations. "We just aren't getting anywhere near as much trade this season," tour operator laments. Is our city really that ugly? Full assessment p. 23.

children.name: Text
children.value: Distinguished guest gifts generously to fabulous [Newspaper FindArticle([RefGuid]) Context TownName], stating "rarely have I seen such pleasant and thriving urbs, in all my years of travel, the honour is all mine..."

children.name: Text
children.value: Splendid [Newspaper FindArticle([RefGuid]) Context TownName] is now the most visited island in existence. It is a beacon of hope, a torch of progress, a paragon of hospitality! Long may it be overrun with tourists!

children.name: Text
children.value: Fire likelihood next to nought in [Newspaper FindArticle([RefGuid]) Context TownName]! Feverish citizens revel in asbestos arcadia, their only fire, a fire of the soul!

children.name: Text
children.value: Chance of fire in [Newspaper FindArticle([RefGuid]) Context TownName] "Irresponsibly high", said despairing fire safety committee following thorough inspections of business and residential premises,"all it takes is one match..."

children.name: Text
children.value: As small fire breaks out in [Newspaper FindArticle([RefGuid]) Context TownName], fears multiply it could become all-consuming inferno! "It's about time we had a great fire," says bystander, "I mean.. it would be terrible of course..."

children.name: Name
children.value: HL - Fire Lv1 Ended With Damage - Bad

children.name: Name
children.value: SL - Fire Lv1 Ended With Damage - Bad

children.name: Text
children.value: Fire guts part of [Newspaper FindArticle([RefGuid]) Context TownName], locals rage at failure of local authority to act. A few more buckets of water for example, and there may have been something salvaged from the blaze.

children.name: Name
children.value: HL - Fire Lv1 Timed Out - Neutral

children.name: Name
children.value: SL - Fire Lv1 Timed Out - Neutral

children.name: Text
children.value: Fire died out of its own accord in [Newspaper FindArticle([RefGuid]) Context TownName]. There is relief mingled with inquiry, as to why the conflagration was allowed to take hold in first place.

children.name: Text
children.value: Firemen do their service proud in [Newspaper FindArticle([RefGuid]) Context TownName], let us never take their sacrifice for granted. "It was only a small fire," says brave fire chief, "I'll tackle worse 'ere the day I die."

children.name: Name
children.value: HL - Fire Lv1 Solved Special Action - Good

children.name: Name
children.value: SL - Fire Lv1 Solved Special Action - Good

children.name: Text
children.value: Singular heroics smother any chance of further fire in [Newspaper FindArticle([RefGuid]) Context TownName], as local authorities act swiftly and decisively to snuff the blaze.

children.name: Text
children.value: Fire becomes inferno in [Newspaper FindArticle([RefGuid]) Context TownName]! As Satanic fire and brimstone erupts to consume our city of sin! See p. 3 for full disclosure of damaged districts.

children.name: Name
children.value: HL - Fire Lv2 Ended With Damage - Bad

children.name: Name
children.value: SL - Fire Lv2 Ended With Damge - Bad

children.name: Text
children.value: Inferno utterly guts [Newspaper FindArticle([RefGuid]) Context TownName], "the city is damned!" croaks broken local, who like many others, has seen their life story disappear in towering columns of smoke.

children.name: Name
children.value: HL - Fire Lv2 Timed Out - Bad

children.name: Name
children.value: SL - Fire Lv2 Timed Out - Bad

children.name: Text
children.value: As horror inferno finally dies out in [Newspaper FindArticle([RefGuid]) Context TownName] there is little consolation for residents, whose lives have been laid waste. "No-one took action!" coughs young mother, "left us for dead!"

children.name: Text
children.value: Inferno flushed out by fearless fire brigade! Fires of passion swell for smoking-hot daredevils, saviours of [Newspaper FindArticle([RefGuid]) Context TownName], who appeared in fine red uniforms at ceremony held in their honour.

children.name: Name
children.value: HL - Fire Lv2 Solved Special Action - Good

children.name: Name
children.value: SL - Fire Lv2 Solved Special Action - Good

children.name: Text
children.value: Emergency procedure saves [Newspaper FindArticle([RefGuid]) Context TownName] from complete incineration by recent inferno! Authorities praised for their handling of the situation, which many believed was beyond hope of rescue!

children.name: Text
children.value: Chance of widescale uprising in delightfully harmonious [Newspaper FindArticle([RefGuid]) Context TownName], as likely as 'winged chimps flying to the moon', say aristocrats confident that not a whiff of popular feeling exists there.

children.name: Text
children.value: People of [Newspaper FindArticle([RefGuid]) Context TownName] 'hell-bent on unleashing era of terror', says man who witnessed others polishing pitchforks. Our paper takes its duty to report injustice seriously, and will stand behind the common folk should they have fair grievance!

children.name: Text
children.value: Local riot in [Newspaper FindArticle([RefGuid]) Context TownName] is first raindrop foreshadowing "flood of revolution", worries politician. "The lower classes must be trampled back down, or society as we know it will be destroyed," he concedes.

children.name: Name
children.value: HL - Riot Lv1 Ended With Damage - Bad

children.name: Name
children.value: SL - Riot Lv1 Ended With Damage - Bad

children.name: Text
children.value: Authorities take blame for inaction in [Newspaper FindArticle([RefGuid]) Context TownName] as riot leaves city in tatters. What was at first regarded as a storm in a teacup, has now resulted in a burned lap!

children.name: Name
children.value: HL - Riot Lv1 Timed Out - Neutral

children.name: Name
children.value: SL - Riot Lv1 Timed Out - Neutral

children.name: Text
children.value: Riot in [Newspaper FindArticle([RefGuid]) Context TownName] ends. Administration fortunate that concerns of populous have subsided naturally, but for how long will the lid remain on the simmering pot?

children.name: Text
children.value: Riotous spasm is easily quelled in [Newspaper FindArticle([RefGuid]) Context TownName], local governor expresses relief that deterrents are working. Authorities put radicals back in their place, see pp. 3-5 for full account of how supremacy was achieved.

children.name: Name
children.value: HL - Riot Lv1 Solved Special Action - Good

children.name: Name
children.value: SL - Riot Lv1 Solved Special Action - Good

children.name: Text
children.value: Dedicated riot measures prevent further spread of dangerous ideology in [Newspaper FindArticle([RefGuid]) Context TownName]! Authorities praised for containing leftist protests with ruthless precision!

children.name: Text
children.value: Cataclysmic revolution in [Newspaper FindArticle([RefGuid]) Context TownName]! Small dribble of discontent becomes pyroclastic flow of public fury! Theme of the century continues, as full-scale rebellion grips the streets.

children.name: Name
children.value: HL - Riot Lv2 Ended With Damage - Bad

children.name: Name
children.value: SL - Riot Lv2 Ended With Damge - Bad

children.name: Text
children.value: Any relief that ugly great revolt has ended is overshadowed by doubt of whether damaged city will ever be the same again. This is not a matter of a few smashed windows, there is widespread damage for the city to contend with, not to mention the lingering bad feeling.

children.name: Name
children.value: HL - Riot Lv2 Timed Out - Bad

children.name: Name
children.value: SL - Riot Lv2 Timed Out - Bad

children.name: Text
children.value: Bloody revolt subsides, but have its sea of angry voices merely gone into hiding? Do the terrifying dissidents wait for the perfect moment to renew their prostestations, more suddenly and violently than ever before?

children.name: Text
children.value: Crowds of delinquent demonstrators convinced to leave the streets of [Newspaper FindArticle([RefGuid]) Context TownName] by well-prepared local authorities. An air of calm is said to have been essential in keeping the deep line of ruffians at bay. Full report pp 2-7.

children.name: Name
children.value: HL - Riot Lv2 Solved Special Action - Good

children.name: Name
children.value: SL - Riot Lv2 Solved Special Action - Good

children.name: Text
children.value: Special government intervention rescues [Newspaper FindArticle([RefGuid]) Context TownName] from the unshakeable madness of revolution! Town treated for especially virulent strain of radicals, whom the authorities deftly managed to isolate!

children.name: Text
children.value: Disease "extraordinarily low" in fit-as-a-fiddle [Newspaper FindArticle([RefGuid]) Context TownName], as medical experts ponder the phenomenon. Whether a cold bath in the morning, a diet of only sprouts, something must be keeping the doctor away!

children.name: Text
children.value: Disease chance high in [Newspaper FindArticle([RefGuid]) Context TownName]! New 'black death' purportedly descending! Will 'Invisible killer' manifest in pus-filled buboes across the abdomen? Yellow, red and blue fever? Or perhaps honeycombing of the face?!

children.name: Text
children.value: Disease grips [Newspaper FindArticle([RefGuid]) Context TownName]! Calls to flush locality of foul air, close schools, even forego Sunday service! Check your symptoms, pp 2-7, but be warned, the graphic descriptions that lie therein are not for the faint of heart!

children.name: Name
children.value: HL - Illness Lv1 Ended With Damage - Bad

children.name: Name
children.value: SL - Illness Lv1 Ended With Damage - Bad

children.name: Text
children.value: Illness in [Newspaper FindArticle([RefGuid]) Context TownName] abates, but leaves affected districts drained of life. "I feel a ghost of my former self" moans figure still swaddled in bedsheet.

children.name: Name
children.value: HL - Illness Lv1 Timed Out - Neutral

children.name: Name
children.value: SL - Illness Lv1 Timed Out - Neutral

children.name: Text
children.value: Disease in [Newspaper FindArticle([RefGuid]) Context TownName] abates before it becomes more serious— thank heavens. Locals ascribe recovery to angels watching over them, and having escaped criticism, the prayers of the authorities must have been answered too!

children.name: Text
children.value: Districts given the all clear in [Newspaper FindArticle([RefGuid]) Context TownName], as brave doctors and nurses do fine job with the equipment and resources they have. "Plenty of rest is all you need, for a tickle in the throat."

children.name: Name
children.value: HL - Illness Lv1 Solved Special Action - Good

children.name: Name
children.value: SL - Illness Lv1 Solved Special Action - Good

children.name: Text
children.value: Success, as special measures are taken to curb further infection in [Newspaper FindArticle([RefGuid]) Context TownName]. "We are lucky a cure for this sickness has already been discovered!" says grateful convalescent.

children.name: Text
children.value: Putrefying epidemic ravages [Newspaper FindArticle([RefGuid]) Context TownName]! Victims contort with agony! Malefic miasma threatens the entire species! Doctors desperately rummaging through cabinets for anything they can find to numb feelings of personal failure...

children.name: Name
children.value: HL - Illness Lv2 Ended With Damage - Bad

children.name: Name
children.value: SL - Illness Lv2 Ended With Damge - Bad

children.name: Text
children.value: Epidemic ends, but leaves [Newspaper FindArticle([RefGuid]) Context TownName] in state of decay. "There are still crosses on the doors, and inside...it's medieval," laments stretcher-bearer.

children.name: Name
children.value: HL - Illness Lv2 Timed Out - Bad

children.name: Name
children.value: SL - Illness Lv2 Timed Out - Bad

children.name: Text
children.value: As vicious epidemic finally relents in [Newspaper FindArticle([RefGuid]) Context TownName], citizens bemoan lack of official intervention that may have prevented it entirely. "Left to our own devices!" says angry woman holding rusty forceps.

children.name: Text
children.value: [Newspaper FindArticle([RefGuid]) Context TownName] returns to full health once more, as residents declare [Participants Current Profile CompanyName] patron saint of the sick and infirm!

children.name: Name
children.value: HL - Illness Lv2 Solved Special Action - Good

children.name: Name
children.value: SL - Illness Lv2 Solved Special Action - Good

children.name: Text
children.value: Special measures ensure [Newspaper FindArticle([RefGuid]) Context TownName] epidemic is neutralised at its epicentre, a triumph of modern medicine!

children.name: Text
children.value: Safety inspections in [Newspaper FindArticle([RefGuid]) Context TownName] show that town industry is unlikely to experience too many blow-outs. "The possibility always remains," inspector remarks, "while the accompanying science is still in its infancy."

children.name: Text
children.value: Haphazard management of industry in [Newspaper FindArticle([RefGuid]) Context TownName] means a catastrophic blow-out is "likely", according to quivering investigator, "we are dabbling in that we don't understand!"

children.name: Name
children.value: HL - Explosion Ended With Damage - Bad

children.name: Name
children.value: SL - Explosion Ended With Damage - Bad

children.name: Text
children.value: Roof blows off industrial heart of [Newspaper FindArticle([RefGuid]) Context TownName]! Tremendous boom precedes widespread destruction by fire, as something goes terribly, terribly wrong in one of its factories, with lack of council foresight blamed.

children.name: Text
children.value: Foundations of World's Fair complete on [Newspaper FindArticle([RefGuid]) Context TownName]! [Participants Current Profile CompanyName] can forgive themselves a small celebration now that the first phase of this mammoth task is over.

children.name: Name
children.value: HL - Monument Construction Phase Started - Good

children.name: Name
children.value: SL - Monument Construction Phase Started - Good

children.name: Text
children.value: Work has begun on the next stage of construction of the World's Fair in [Newspaper FindArticle([RefGuid]) Context TownName], and to great excitement! If crowds are gathering only to witness the construction, imagine how many will flock to its opening!

children.name: Name
children.value: HL - Monument Construction Phase Finished - Good

children.name: Name
children.value: SL - Monument Construction Phase Finished - Good

children.name: Text
children.value: Opening day of World's Fair edges ever-closer in [Newspaper FindArticle([RefGuid]) Context TownName] as significant chapter in the construction ends. Clear progress is being made, and it is all very exciting.

children.name: Text
children.value: Magnificent monument in [Newspaper FindArticle([RefGuid]) Context TownName] "firmly on track" to have ribbon cut on expected date, remarks building's architect, "great things take time, we had expected that."

children.name: Name
children.value: HL - Monument Construction Slowed Present - Bad

children.name: Name
children.value: SL - Monument Construction Slowed Present - Bad

children.name: Text
children.value: Significant delays plague [Participants Current Profile CompanyName] in the construction of its World's Fair. People of [Newspaper FindArticle([RefGuid]) Context TownName] grumble it is pork barrel politics, amid fears city may be overreaching.

children.name: Name
children.value: HL - Monument Construction Stopped Present - Bad

children.name: Name
children.value: SL - Monument Construction Stopped Present - Bad

children.name: Text
children.value: Desperate concern for World's Fair complex in [Newspaper FindArticle([RefGuid]) Context TownName] after construction was unexpectedly halted. Many were already calling the project a white elephant— goodness knows what they shall make of the venture now.

children.name: Text
children.value: World's Fair opens in [Newspaper FindArticle([RefGuid]) Context TownName]. [Participants Current Profile CompanyName] is proud new owner of the venue, achieving a feat we would never have imagined as the beginning of this extraordinary century!

children.name: Text
children.value: Celebration of architecture opens to visitors at World's Fair in [Newspaper FindArticle([RefGuid]) Context TownName]! Neo-classicist, Gothic, Romanesque— muse upon the themes of the age, behold all variety of decor-ornamentation, be inspired! Plan of the show floor p.17.

children.name: Text
children.value: As delicious architectural pageant closes in [Newspaper FindArticle([RefGuid]) Context TownName], designers and planners everywhere wax poetic over the event— "A triumph of modern collaborations", "a treasure trove for planners", "Civic inspiration!"

children.name: Text
children.value: Scientific extravaganza opens to public in [Newspaper FindArticle([RefGuid]) Context TownName]! World's fair presents its most novel exhibition; a futurescape bizarro; vast displays of mechanical apparatus, the brainchildren of the world's foremost innovators!

children.name: Text
children.value: Though miraculous exhibition of science has sadly ended in [Newspaper FindArticle([RefGuid]) Context TownName], every visitor left positively charged! All agreed their eyes had been opened to the remarkable possibilities that lie ahead of us!

children.name: Text
children.value: The past comes to life in [Newspaper FindArticle([RefGuid]) Context TownName]! Bewildering paleoethnoanthroarcheologistic discoveries see light of day after centuries dormant! Open yourself the cabinet of curiosity! Drawer after drawer of meticulously-categorised finds!

children.name: Text
children.value: As celebrated archaeological exhibition closes in [Newspaper FindArticle([RefGuid]) Context TownName], visitors chime in agreement over its success. To have gained so much, both in spirit and tangibly from the past, has helped us understand our place in time better than ever.

children.name: Text
children.value: An expedition is officially underway, after months poring over maps and gathering the necessary expertise! Magnificent crew have spring in step according to the Captain, let us hope their enthusiasm will help them prevail!

children.name: Text
children.value: Expedition achieves the unthinkable, as crew surmount innumerable obstacles and reach their goal! "It is the longest tale, a fable of the sea...of monsters real, and imagined, of—" the proud Captain began, before we cut him off. A great crowd was present to cheer them home.

children.name: Text
children.value: Expedition goes terribly awry! Despair as expedition ship returns in bits, its crew mad and mutinous! Perhaps it is better we do not know what took place aboard the fateful voyage, for we could never fully understand the horror of it all!

children.name: Text
children.value: A specialist has become the latest casualty of the ill-fated expedition whose crew left port not so long ago with hope in their hearts, and dreams of all the great wonders of the world. The only wonder now is whether any of the poor fools will return.

children.name: Text
children.value: The [Newspaper FindArticle([RefGuid]) Context ObjectName] was sold to [Newspaper FindArticle([RefGuid]) Context ParticipantName]

children.name: Text
children.value: The [Newspaper FindArticle([RefGuid]) Context ObjectName] was bought from [Newspaper FindArticle([RefGuid]) Context ParticipantName]

children.name: Text
children.value: A firm alliance between proud nations is achieved! The new partnership is set to be of vast importance to the immediate, even long-term futures of both sides. The final deal was mooted and passed under the noses, and more importantly, pens of the diplomatic suits in record time—

children.name: Name
children.value: HL - Diplomacy Alliance Player Cancelled - Neutral

children.name: Name
children.value: SL - Diplomacy Alliance Player Cancelled - Neutral

children.name: Text
children.value: "The decision does not mean our ongoing relations need turn nasty," was the official statement on cancelled alliance with [Newspaper FindArticle([RefGuid]) Context ParticipantName], and "no reason" why "alliance wouldn't be possible again in the future."

children.name: Name
children.value: HL - Diplomacy Alliance Player Cancelled Other Participant - Bad

children.name: Name
children.value: SL - Diplomacy Alliance Player Cancelled Other Participant - Bad

children.name: Text
children.value: Key alliance breaks down! With former ally [Newspaper FindArticle([RefGuid]) Context ParticipantName] providing no answers, officials left to speculate the reason they withdrew support. It is unclear how this disappointing news has been received at the highest level.

children.name: Name
children.value: HL - Diplomacy Trade Agreement Player - Good

children.name: Name
children.value: SL - Diplomacy Trade Agreement Player - Good

children.name: Text
children.value: A profitable new partnership with [Newspaper FindArticle([RefGuid]) Context ParticipantName]! Our correspondent furnishes us with the latest figures, and trumpets the immediate economic gains from the deal.

children.name: Name
children.value: HL - Diplomacy Trade Agreement Cancelled Player - Neutral

children.name: Name
children.value: SL - Diplomacy Trade Agreement Cancelled Player - Neutral

children.name: Text
children.value: Future plans do not include trade with [Newspaper FindArticle([RefGuid]) Context ParticipantName], if the rumours are to be believed. Who benefits the most from the decision? More perspective on the economic landscape on page 12!

children.name: Name
children.value: HL - Diplomacy Trade Agreement Cancelled Player Other Participant - Bad

children.name: Name
children.value: SL - Diplomacy Trade Agreement Cancelled Player Other Participant - Bad

children.name: Text
children.value: [Newspaper FindArticle([RefGuid]) Context ParticipantName] severs trade ties in shock for local business! What might have been a fruitful relationship comes to cruelly to an end, as partner reneges on promises. Sharp decline in economy forecasted with steep-looking graphs on page 4.

children.name: Name
children.value: HL - Diplomacy Peace Treaty Player - Good

children.name: Name
children.value: SL - Diplomacy Peace Treaty Player - Good

children.name: Text
children.value: Peace at last! [Newspaper SpecialEditionContext ParticipantName] signs treaty! Ambassadors return from the negotiating table with olive branch, white doves rise to the skies, children skip gladly through meadows. The war is over! Let the colour return to our cheeks!

children.name: Name
children.value: HL - Diplomacy Cease Fire Player - Good

children.name: Name
children.value: SL - Diplomacy Cease Fire Player - Good

children.name: Text
children.value: A ceasefire has been agreed. Whether moved to act by the destruction, or the strategic value of a pause, matters not. Wounds can now be licked, the situation reappraised, and perhaps, peace may be contemplated. The leaders of forces on both sides are said to be content with the situation.

children.name: Name
children.value: HL - Diplomacy Cease Fire Player Ended - Bad

children.name: Name
children.value: SL - Diplomacy Cease Fire Player Ended - Bad

children.name: Text
children.value: "No," say Admirals as conflict resumes following a period of ceasefire. Navies muster, sailors polish their cannons, powder is poured from kegs as the parties re-enter the pugilist's ring for another round. When will this needless bloodshed cease?!

children.name: Text
children.value: The powers that be have elected to go to war! Recruitment has already begun, lives at stake to uphold our values, to preserve unity and order, to meet danger half-way with zealous alacrity. Time will tell if it is a choice founded on wisdom.

children.name: Name
children.value: HL - Diplomacy War Player Other Participant - Bad

children.name: Name
children.value: SL - Diplomacy War Player Other Participant - Bad

children.name: Text
children.value: [Newspaper SpecialEditionContext ParticipantName] declares war! Peace and humanity desert us, as Mephistophelian adversary rises from the depths to confront us! We can only trust in our bravest to fight back this nemesis, and drive ruination from our shores.

children.name: Name
children.value: HL - Diplomacy Alliance Other Participant - Neutral

children.name: Name
children.value: SL - Diplomacy Alliance Other Participant - Neutral

children.name: Text
children.value: An alliance has formed between two of our rivals. Speculation mounts as to what they may be up to. Of course, their intentions could be perfectly chivalrous, but while any doubt remains, speculation of the more ignoble variety shall no doubt stir in the pool.

children.name: Name
children.value: HL - Diplomacy Alliance Other Participant Cancelled - Neutral

children.name: Name
children.value: SL - Diplomacy Alliance Other Participant Cancelled - Neutral

children.name: Text
children.value: An alliance between our rivals has broken down. In the following days, rumour is likely to gather as to that which broke the spell between them. It is unknown for example, whether this development will be seen positively or negatively here. More to follow.

children.name: Name
children.value: HL - Diplomacy Trade Agreement Other Participant - Neutral

children.name: Name
children.value: SL - Diplomacy Trade Agreement Other Participant - Neutral

children.name: Text
children.value: New agreements reached among our neighbours this forenoon—more details in today's Foreign Diplomacy, Trade and Things You Should Care About But Won't column.

children.name: Name
children.value: HL - Diplomacy Trade Agreement Other Participant Cancelled - Neutral

children.name: Name
children.value: SL - Diplomacy Trade Agreement Other Participant Cancelled - Neutral

children.name: Text
children.value: A trade agreement between rival powers has been cancelled. It seems they no longer saw eye-to-eye on the subject. Whether boom of this minor diplomatic eruption will reach our shores, remains to be seen.

children.name: Name
children.value: HL - Diplomacy Peace Treaty Other Participant - Neutral

children.name: Name
children.value: SL - Diplomacy Peace Treaty Other Participant - Neutral

children.name: Text
children.value: A peace treaty between rivals overseas has finally been kissed with a seal. Perhaps this grand gesture can seed a future of peace and progress. Or perhaps such wimpish withdrawals are symptomatic of this too-liberal age!

children.name: Name
children.value: HL - Diplomacy Cease Fire Other Participant - Neutral

children.name: Name
children.value: SL - Diplomacy Cease Fire Other Participant - Neutral

children.name: Text
children.value: A truce has been established between our neighbours. Pious hearts, non-partisans, will be glad that for a time, the suffering does not have to continue. How long will empathy last? Hortense McGough remarks upon the situation from the place of amnesty.

children.name: Name
children.value: HL - Diplomacy Cease Fire Other Participant Ended - Neutral

children.name: Name
children.value: SL - Diplomacy Cease Fire Other Participant Ended - Neutral

children.name: Text
children.value: A ceasefire has ended between two of our neighbours, meaning that it cannot be long before the first shot rings out into the night, and their forces are on top of one another once again. Let us hope the same winds of war do not blow this way. Full report pages 31-37.

children.name: Name
children.value: HL - Diplomacy War Other Participant - Neutral

children.name: Name
children.value: SL - Diplomacy War Other Participant - Neutral

children.name: Text
children.value: Our neighbours have declared war on one another. An intercepted telegram confirmed the news, which many believe had been brewing for some time - now the line is crossed, the damn burst! No reason for us to react however - neutrals should dissemble and play dumb!

children.name: Text
children.value: Pirate nuisance return, disproving reports they had been wiped out! Hidden coves making motley, pestilential denizens of the black flag hard to sniff out. Let us hope it is only a matter of time before  these skeletons of the last century go under for good!

children.name: Name
children.value: HL - Diplomacy Reputation Reduced Significantly - Bad

children.name: Name
children.value: SL - Diplomacy Reputation Reduced Significantly - Bad

children.name: Text
children.value: Diplomatic relations with [Newspaper FindArticle([RefGuid]) Context ParticipantName] have "deteriorated" recently, say disgruntled ambassadors, as "consequence of innate differences between us". We hope importance of maintaining good relations with neighbours is not being overlooked.

children.name: Name
children.value: HL - Diplomacy Reputation Increased Significantly - Good

children.name: Name
children.value: SL - Diplomacy Reputation Increased Significantly - Good

children.name: Text
children.value: Relations with [Newspaper FindArticle([RefGuid]) Context ParticipantName] have improved recently, say jovial ambassadors! Glasses clinked, and trays of finely-wrought chocolate pralines did circulate, as improved standing with our counterparts called for celebration.

children.name: Name
children.value: HL - Diplomacy Non Attack Player - Good

children.name: Name
children.value: SL - Diplomacy Non Attack Player - Good

children.name: Text
children.value: Reliable partnership with [Newspaper FindArticle([RefGuid]) Context ParticipantName] deepened with new contract.

children.name: Name
children.value: HL - Diplomacy Non Attack Other Participant - Neutral

children.name: Name
children.value: SL - Diplomacy Non Attack Other Participant - Neutral

children.name: Text
children.value: [Newspaper FindArticle([RefGuid]) Context ParticipantName] signs non aggression pact with another player.

children.name: Text
children.value: Many ships lost! Naval defeats follow with painful frequency, as calamitous maneuvers and decisions show weakness in leadership. Admiral first sealord asked for comment, but wiping tear from corner of his eye, he would only put his palm to his heart and solemnly sing the anthem.

children.name: Text
children.value: So many fine buildings lost to destruction! City ravaged by war! Architects frantically unroll emergency plans to rebuild as violence continues. Many parts of the city are unrecognisable! Full scale of devastation sketched out by ou artist-at-the-scene Henri Dugarry...

children.name: Text
children.value: Enemy makes mockery of our defences, seizing several key trading posts! Embarassing lack of prowess in war likely to spell the end, if wholesale changes to our forces are not undertaken soon! Revel in full scale of devastation as covered throughout today's edition.

children.name: Text
children.value: We have sunk countless ships— proof of titanic fortitude in the face of enemy aggression! As the waves swim red with the blood of our foe, whisky shoots from the nostrils of our admirals as they guffaw with laughter! More on the genius minds behind our navy below.

children.name: Text
children.value: Enemy structures crumble under fire! The crashes, bangs, and rumbles paralyse the enemy! Praise for our brave forces, and their ruthless expertise in demolition!

children.name: Text
children.value: The vast sea battle is unsurprisingly the major subject of discussion at home and abroad, with the outcome arguably decisive in settling the ongoing feud with our rivals. With the outcome in the balance, we must remain hopeful of a famous triumph. Continues p.3.

children.name: Text
children.value: Enemy fleet taken apart! Singular success for our proud fleet, in one of the largest sea battles in recent memory! Surely now the war shall be over, and all our enemies shall lay sword and shield at our feet in due deference! Speculation as to precisely how it was won pp.2-19.

children.name: Text
children.value: Humiliation! Huge sea battle ends as enemy cuts through our fleet! Eyewitness accounts of the failure sadly lost to the deep! Will crashing defeat finally condemn us to being forgotten footnote in history? Post-mortem continues pp. 2-15.

children.name: Name
children.value: HL - Military Island War Defense Started - Bad

children.name: Name
children.value: SL - Military Island War Defense Started - Bad

children.name: Text
children.value: Assault begins on our beloved home! Is it true we are left undefended by sea? That we must fight back this foe alone? Seeking advice as a civilian? We shall endeavour —for as long as we are able— to bring you round-the-dial reports on the situation.

children.name: Name
children.value: HL - Military Island War Defense Won - Good

children.name: Name
children.value: SL - Military Island War Defense Won - Good

children.name: Text
children.value: Rejoice, our city endures! Foolhardy enemy assault rebuffed after skirmishes! The coast is clear, at least for now. Debrief at headquarters due later today. Armchair accounts of the final battle in our beleaguered city correspondent's testimony throughout this edition.

children.name: Name
children.value: HL - Military Island War Defense Lost - Bad

children.name: Name
children.value: SL - Military Island War Defense Lost - Bad

children.name: Text
children.value: The enemy has captured [Newspaper FindArticle([RefGuid]) Context TownName], putting an end to our brave, but ultimately futile resistance. The local residents will have no choice but to swear allegaince with their new masters now.

children.name: Name
children.value: HL - Military Island War Offense Started - Good

children.name: Name
children.value: SL - Military Island War Offense Started - Good

children.name: Text
children.value: Enemy harbour receives barrage from our forces, sure to collapse under the indefatigable efforts of our nation, proudly united in the belief that this is a fine and wonderful idea. We here at this paper, certainly, are unanimous in our support!

children.name: Name
children.value: HL - Military Island War Offense Won - Good

children.name: Name
children.value: SL - Military Island War Offense Won - Good

children.name: Text
children.value: Assault on [Newspaper FindArticle([RefGuid]) Context TownName] ensures island is taken by force! The enemy resolve was whittled down, until their defences were breached, and a flagpole bearing our colours was driven deeply into the soil, to make official our newest territory!

children.name: Name
children.value: HL - Military Island War Offense Lost - Bad

children.name: Name
children.value: SL - Military Island War Offense Lost - Bad

children.name: Text
children.value: Overly optimistic assault on [Newspaper FindArticle([RefGuid]) Context TownName] duly ends in failure for our bumbling forces! Cavalier attitudes to the enemy will "not pay in the long run," say many worried this will now turn the tide against us!

children.name: Name
children.value: HL - Military Island War Offense Morale Low - Bad

children.name: Name
children.value: SL - Military Island War Offense Morale Low - Bad

children.name: Text
children.value: People of [Newspaper FindArticle([RefGuid]) Context TownName] already imagining life under enemy as their will to hold out wobbles. Reports show morale is at its lowest ebb! It cannot be long before we are forced to give up our city to the enemy for good!

children.name: Name
children.value: HL - Military Island War Started Other Participants - Neutral

children.name: Name
children.value: SL - Military Island War Started Other Participants - Neutral

children.name: Text
children.value: One of our rivals is besieged by an enemy fleet, news has filtered through from over the water. What is no doubt a disturbing development for them, may "not necessarily" be so grave for us, remarks our expert Commander Button, whose full appraisal may be enjoyed overleaf.

children.name: Name
children.value: HL - Military Island War Ended Other Participants - Neutral

children.name: Name
children.value: SL - Military Island War Ended Other Participants - Neutral

children.name: Text
children.value: The island of our rival will remain in their possession, following a successful defensive campaign against the enemy. Regardless of the result, the news is sure to be a relief to the long-suffering people on both sides.

children.name: Name
children.value: HL - Military Island War Won Other Participants - Neutral

children.name: Name
children.value: SL - Military Island War Won Other Participants - Neutral

children.name: Text
children.value: Our rival's island has fallen to the enemy, after a prolonged assault finally broke the local resistance. The transfer of ownership is immediate, but the lasting effects of this coup are yet to emerge as an outline from the clouds of gunpowder. More on Politics, pp3-5.

children.name: Name
children.value: HL - Military Island War Defence Morale Low - Good

children.name: Name
children.value: SL - Military Island War Defence Morale Low - Good

children.name: Text
children.value: The morale of our enemy is drained, according to letters intercepted by friends of this publication! It cannot be long before assault on [Newspaper FindArticle([RefGuid]) Context TownName] succeeds, with the city liberated to our cause!

children.name: Text
children.value: [Participants Current Profile CompanyName] is a good samaritan, offering help to those in need. Recent success in trial of public responsibility proves our esteemed leader's equanimity in the face of adversity.

children.name: Name
children.value: HL - Quest Completed Success Several - Good

children.name: Name
children.value: SL - Quest Completed Success Several - Good

children.name: Text
children.value: Our sublimely philanthropic premier [Participants Current Profile CompanyName] achieves success after success in the public sphere, displaying remarkable compassion and willigness to intercede whenever others appear in need of support.

children.name: Text
children.value: [Participants Current Profile CompanyName] attempts to help, but only makes things worse! "It's all very well agreeing to do something, provided that you then do it," stated source close to our leader, wishing to remain nameless.

children.name: Name
children.value: HL - City Attractiveness Status Increased - Good

children.name: Name
children.value: SL - City Attractiveness Status Increased - Good

children.name: Text
children.value: [Newspaper FindArticle([RefGuid]) Context TownName] has become noticeably more attractive! Recent campaigns to beautifiy the city's avenues and boulevards have begun to pay dividends for tourism, as scenic vistas captivate the popular imagination.

children.name: Name
children.value: HL - City Attractiveness Status Reduced - Bad

children.name: Name
children.value: SL - City Attractiveness Status Reduced - Bad

children.name: Text
children.value: [Newspaper FindArticle([RefGuid]) Context TownName] "has let itself go," according to one of many visitors who claim the city is losing its appeal. Travel agents scratch their heads, saying, "there must be something we can do to get the turnstiles spinning again."

children.name: Name
children.value: HL - City Attractiveness Status Maximum Reached - Good

children.name: Text
children.value: MOST BEAUTIFUL CITY IN THE WORLD

children.name: Name
children.value: SL - City Attractiveness Status Maximum Reached - Good

children.name: Text
children.value: [Newspaper FindArticle([RefGuid]) Context TownName] is the fairest city of them all according to independent panel of aesthetes! In exhaustive list of magical destinations, our wondrous city emerged at the top! Scoff at the rest on the list pp. 24-25.

children.name: Name
children.value: HL - City Attractiveness Status Maximum Reached Other Participant - Neutral

children.name: Name
children.value: SL - City Attractiveness Status Maximum Reached Other Participant - Neutral

children.name: Text
children.value: [Newspaper FindArticle([RefGuid]) Context TownName] is now the most beautiful city ever built, most likely that shall "ever be built", according to renowned art historian. "A beauty timeless, universal— unsurpassable, may this singular jewel never be taken from us."

children.name: Name
children.value: HL - Hostile Takeover Share Sold NPC From NPC - Neutral

children.name: Name
children.value: SL - Hostile Takeover Share Sold NPC From NPC - Neutral

children.name: Text
children.value: A share in a rival company has been sold, we hear. The news broke during trading, and the full effects are not expected to be seen for a short while yet. It is not clear if the party who sold were forced into the sale, but the move won't fill their backers with confidence.

children.name: Name
children.value: HL - Hostile Takeover Share Sold NPC From Player - Neutral

children.name: Name
children.value: SL - Hostile Takeover Share Sold NPC From Player - Neutral

children.name: Text
children.value: Our company sells shares to a third-party! On the reasons for doing so, it is pure speculation. We debate the move in an opinion piece, questioning the long-term objectives, but in praise of the short-term gains of such an arrangement.

children.name: Name
children.value: HL - Hostile Takeover Share Sold Player From NPC - Neutral

children.name: Name
children.value: SL - Hostile Takeover Share Sold Player From NPC - Neutral

children.name: Text
children.value: We have sold our company shares in [Newspaper FindArticle([RefGuid]) Context TownName], for reasons as yet unknown. "Perhaps the investment just wasn't paying off," says veteran bookkeeper, "in which case it would be a sensible decision."

children.name: Name
children.value: HL - Hostile Takeover Share Sold Player from Player - Neutral

children.name: Name
children.value: SL - Hostile Takeover Share Sold Player from Player - Neutral

children.name: Text
children.value: Rival sells their share in [Newspaper FindArticle([RefGuid]) Context TownName], for reasons as yet unknown. "Perhaps their investment just wasn't paying off," says bookkeeper, "in which case it is sensible for them to back down."

children.name: Name
children.value: HL - Hostile Takeover Share Bought NPC From Player - Bad

children.name: Name
children.value: SL - Hostile Takeover Share Bought NPC From Player - Bad

children.name: Text
children.value: Rival buys shares, targetting future takeover! Sinister intentions transparent at stakeholder meeting, according to sources present. A complete transfer of assets would be effectuated, should rival party ever hold a majority. Can we buy back a slice of the pie? pp. 13-14.

children.name: Name
children.value: HL - Hostile Takeover Share Bought Player From NPC - Good

children.name: Name
children.value: SL - Hostile Takeover Share Bought Player From NPC - Good

children.name: Text
children.value: Shares bought in rival business! A finger in the pie, leading to future takeover perhaps? While a sizeable initial outlay, the investment in our rivals can come good later. Should a majority ever be had, the door would open for a tantalising takeover.

children.name: Name
children.value: HL - Hostile Takeover Share Bought Back NPC - Bad

children.name: Name
children.value: SL - Hostile Takeover Share Bought Back NPC - Bad

children.name: Text
children.value: Shares bought back by rival! Company investment trumped by greater purchase power. The bi-monthly shareholder dinner was ruined by the news, with flabbergasted guests busting out of their suits.

children.name: Name
children.value: HL - Hostile Takeover Share Bought Back Player - Good

children.name: Name
children.value: SL - Hostile Takeover Share Bought Back Player - Good

children.name: Text
children.value: Shares now under our control again! A victory in the long struggle against a majority takeover, this decisive play could mean our independence is secured for sometime yet. Only with such determintaion can we show our would-be usurpers we mean business.

children.name: Name
children.value: HL - Hostile Takeover Share Bought Back NPC From NPC - Neutral

children.name: Name
children.value: SL - Hostile Takeover Share Bought Back NPC From NPC - Neutral

children.name: Text
children.value: A rival has bought shares in another business. A prestige move for them, indubitably, but our economic expert writes of the inevitable repercussions in the small world of finance.

children.name: Name
children.value: HL - Hostile Takeover Possible NPC - Bad

children.name: Name
children.value: SL - Hostile Takeover Possible NPC - Bad

children.name: Text
children.value: Rival ready to seize [Newspaper FindArticle([RefGuid]) Context TownName]! Catastrophic financial takeover seems inevitable! Not content with partial ownership, our adversary would seize this nest of ours, and all that lieth within, like the most indecent variety of cuckoo!

children.name: Name
children.value: HL - Hostile Takeover Possible Player - Good

children.name: Name
children.value: SL - Hostile Takeover Possible Player - Good

children.name: Text
children.value: An island is there for the taking, and opportunity never knocks twice at anyone's door! "More is more!" say hopeful henchpersons of our company, lips a-drool with the prospects such an acqusition would bring about.

children.name: Name
children.value: HL - Hostile Takeover Finished By Player - Good

children.name: Name
children.value: SL - Hostile Takeover Finished By Player - Good

children.name: Text
children.value: Devious hostile takeover success! Investment pays off, as new city joins the fold! A mail steamer brought with it amended company valuations for the start of trading— a great and instantaneous surge in assets! Improved portfolio is celebrated in our special pull-out within.

children.name: Name
children.value: HL - Hostile Takeover Finished By NPC - Bad

children.name: Name
children.value: SL - Hostile Takeover Finished By NPC - Bad

children.name: Text
children.value: [Newspaper FindArticle([RefGuid]) Context TownName] swiped by our rival! As hostile takeover goes through, does it spell the end for our company? What future plans for the place our rival has, are not ours to know, but grim faces on the streets tell the story.

children.name: Name
children.value: HL - Hostile Takeover Share Income Enemy Present - Bad

children.name: Name
children.value: SL - Hostile Takeover Share Income Enemy Present - Bad

children.name: Text
children.value: We are being milked by our rivals, as their greater proportion of shares drains our coffers! Anger as money perceived to be evaporating, that might instead have been put towards improving our people's comfort and wellbeing.

children.name: Name
children.value: HL - Hostile Takeover Share Income Self Present - Good

children.name: Name
children.value: SL - Hostile Takeover Share Income Self Present - Good

children.name: Text
children.value: We are milking our rivals, holding a greater proportion of shares means our coffers are filling up! Delight as this news may mean greater investment into our people's comfort and wellbeing is on the horizon.

children.name: Name
children.value: HL - Victory Conditions Bankruptcy Other Participant - Neutral

children.name: Name
children.value: SL - Victory Conditions Bankruptcy Other Participant - Neutral

children.name: Text
children.value: [Newspaper FindArticle([RefGuid]) Context ParticipantName] trades for the last time as debts become insurmountable! Whatever the reason for this sorry state of affairs, it is history now— and hardly a concern for us.

children.name: Name
children.value: HL - Victory Conditions Annihilation Other Participant - Neutral

children.name: Name
children.value: SL - Victory Conditions Annihilation Other Participant - Neutral

children.name: Text
children.value: [Newspaper FindArticle([RefGuid]) Context ParticipantName] surrenders everything, as last defenders fall! Sharks swarm over corpse of trading empire, now gone for good. Once the smoke has cleared, we may gauge what all this portends for us.

children.name: Name
children.value: HL - Victory Conditions NPC Annihilated By Player - Positive

children.name: Name
children.value: SL - Victory Conditions NPC Annihilated By Player - Positive

children.name: Text
children.value: Long-lasting enmity comes to triumphant end after conquest and imprisonment of our Nation's only remaining competitor. Experts guarantee only brilliant prospects now for [Participants Current Profile CompanyName] and our people!

children.name: Name
children.value: HL - Victory Conditions NPC Progress Towards Victory - Negative

children.name: Name
children.value: SL - Victory Conditions NPC Progress Towards Victory - Negative

children.name: Text
children.value: Worries for [Participants Current Profile CompanyName] and others, as rival makes large step towards blasting the competition out of the water.

children.name: Text
children.value: New Sawmill in [Newspaper FindArticle([RefGuid]) Context TownName] can "send sparks flying", beam new employees of the plant. Timber is a tried and trusted ally, even as modern materials make their presence felt.

children.name: Text
children.value: New Fishery flaps into life in [Newspaper FindArticle([RefGuid]) Context TownName], residents become hooked. "Fishing is traditional," says recruit fisherman, as company trawls town for willing seafarers.

children.name: Text
children.value: New Schnapps Distillery has people of [Newspaper FindArticle([RefGuid]) Context TownName] in tremendously high spirits! Notes of potato on the palate proving unexpectedly popular...

children.name: Text
